author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1705775129}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201814460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1694312704}
review:
One of the worst game I've played, sadly...
I don't even know where to start...
Just wanted to get the achievements done and I'm never gonna open this game again...
The miss/evade rate of the zombies is stupid high (which makes no sense imho lol) and your characters miss again and again and AGAIN!! (which is totally frustrating...)
Only one of your character can heal... for like 50-65? Zombies hit you for over 100 (not counting the pyre(?) which can hit your whole party for like 200 or something) unless you get stronger armors which is rare as fuck unless you kill the werecar? (I think)
There's no way to fill your AP which is used for skills so once you're out, you're out....
Seems like no way to get characters back if they die, even if you "get them back" after a reroll... Still dead...
This game just sucks. 
Just kinda sad I didn't play it earlier after buying it, would clearly ask for a refund...

author: {'steamid': '76561198095293908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 360, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1682722667}
review: This game is an unfinished mess. It encourages repetitive gameplay that is neither fun nor rewarding. There are several mechanics that have yet to be fully implemented and the advertisement video is not even the final game. The character's cannot regain mp and therefore special attacks mean nothing. It's just a broken unfinished project masquerading as a game. Avoid this game like the plague.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078403549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 581, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1677169322}
review:
RPGMaker engine and gameplay-focused game with no story is really poor combination. Standard RPGMaker combat, unbalanced gameplay and rather bugs (e.g. walking about of map). I'll just click "I want to permanently remove this game from my account" after writing this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131414661', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1668910808}
review:
[b]UNLIMITED ZOMBIE, APOCALYPSE WITH NO END[/b]

[h1]3.3
EMOTIONAL DAMAGE[/h1]

This game will make you itchy. No option, no tutorial, enter the game and play. Then you will stay in the room and explore what is right there. You can't go out untill you click the door. This is RPG but when you want exit you should press the button. When enter, just walking through it. Ok not just that, after you go outside the zombie will chase you. If you strong enough, you can beat them. There is also a partner that you can find after exploring all the place. The purpose of this game is nothing. So the devs helps you with the achievement to make it as a goal. Because the dev said this concept game is endless survivor. You play untill you get bored. Most annoying moment is the bug. This game still have some bug in everywhere. You stuck and can walk through door while inside building. There is an item that make you invisible to avoid zombies. If not use it, a gang of zombie will come to you and start the fight. Also this game have energy bar that after you fight against zombie, it will decreasing. Random drop will help you get energy only if you get food. If not get food, your journey will end. To many hole in this game.

[+]
- RPG MAP CONCEPT IS NICE
- NO BUG ACHIEVEMENT
- NOT BAD ART
- FRIENDLY SLOT SAVE DATA

[-]
- NOT SUITABLE BGM
- MANY BUG 
- ANNOYING ZOMBIES DAMAGE
- UNFAIR MISS HIT WHEN YOU ATTACK ZOMBIES
- NOOB HEALER
- USELESS WEAPON
- RANDOM FOOD DROP THAT DECIDE YOUR FAITH
- BAD MECHANISM

[b][i]Invasion: Brain Craving[/i][/b] is a survival zombie game in RPG concept. You beat them, get the level and getting stronger but there is no point to do that. The goal that you can do is clear the achievement and you can finish it after get all of it. There are 8 character in game that will help you grinding. You need to search one by one while leveling. Can be outside and inside the building. I'm not recommend it, this game is not good. Choice are on you. Thank you for reading, hope you have fun guys~

author: {'steamid': '76561198021864291', 'num_games_owned': 1728, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1667682417}
review:
So...New Reality Games. Mir war schon lÃ¤nger bewusst, dass ihr versucht das Monopol von Back to Basics Gaming anzukratzen. Jetzt hab ich den Beweis, auch wenn die Tat schon etwas in der Vergangenheit liegt.
Ein Spiel in einer Zombieapokalypse ist kein seltenes Setting und auch die Kombination mit JRPG ist jetzt keine Revolution.
Aaaaber: Vor einer Weile spielte ich von besagter Konkurrenzfirma ein Spiel namens "Eaten Alive" und Ã¼berraschend fand ich, dass die Map des Spiels quasi 1:1 die gleiche ist, wie in Invasion: Brain Craving (Random Map Generator am Arsch). Hmmmmm. Hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm. 
Und es kam 2015. Ein Jahr vorher. Hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.
Ein Schelm der Diebstahl vermutet. Ja, was soll man da noch sagen? Also wirklich...bin echt sprachlos.

Und leider beim ersten Auto, dass mich anfuhr und dann in einen Kampf mit ein paar weiteren Zombies verwickelte gestorben, aber das hat auch nichts mehr gerettet. Also die Idee, dass man gegen Autos kÃ¤mpfen kann ist schon lustig. Aber fÃ¼r diese Straftat, die, man munkelt, gerichtliche Folgen haben kÃ¶nnte, da kann ich leider nur den Daumen Runter geben. Und kommt mir nicht mit so einer plumpen Ausrede wie "Ist halt eine RPG Maker Standardmap". Das bringt euch in Teufels KÃ¼che, Kollegen.
Boah ist mir schlecht. Da geh ich lieber bei der Konkurrenz einkaufen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002954695', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1664672473}
review:
Somebody once said to me: "The greate thing about game engines is, they allow everyone with an idea to create a game!"

I like to point at games like this and say in response: "Sadly they also allow anyone with NO IDEA to make games too."

Maybe its not the lack of ideas here, but certainly a lack of endurance, talent or simply knowing when you should not publish something that is clearly unfinished.

review:
I *WANT* to like this game. Heck, I see a lot of old-school-fun potential in it, but when finds themselves consistiently one-shotted from full health by almost constant crits from the zeds, it becomes a bit of a chore to move past a couple of screens... and I have enough chores to do at home.

Giving this one a 4.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197987600149', 'num_games_owned': 2205, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1565623500}
review:
This game combines two really tired tropes, zombies, and RPGmaker asset flips.

There's little to no story, and enemies have laughably high HP totals. There's little balance, the game is kinda boring, and for me I had absolutely no sound or music no matter what I did or how I launched the game on more than one system.It's boring.

review: I let random game picker decide for me what to play and it picked this. Didn't expect much, but in the end I was really suprised. It's good time waster with good (but repetitive) soundtrack. I actually wish there was more to this game. It has a potential for good story which is missing, more weapons and bigger map than 3x3 (I really like the random generator).

author: {'steamid': '76561198205074691', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1524169811}
review: Invasion is unfinished and has a lot of issues but despite not being to recommend it I still had some fun playing it. Some of the issues include the only MP restoring item does not restore MP so you can use a skill once or twice before they are useless. The two "survivor" party members get a skill but the skill does not appear in either the combat menu or in the menus outside of combat. Enemies drop "scrap" which I imagine may have been currency but there is nowhere to spend or use any of it. I can't recommend buying this game on its own but if you're looking at a bundle and it's in there its not terrible, you might enjoy it for an hour or two.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997098607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1522875007}
review:
Low-effort quick-cash-grab game made using bought assets.

[h1]-[/h1]
[list]
[*]got stuck on terrain in the first 5 minutes
[*]"blank" enemies when encountering werecar
[*]limited health packs and too many zombies
[*]have to use cheat (ghostmode) to play
[*]no options
[*]no instructions on controls
[*]game was hobbled together from bought assets to make a quick buck
[*]no steam overlay
[*]no use for scrap(currency)
[*]game crashes on exit on windows 10
[*]no abilities to use in the beginning, resulting in constant attack spam grind
[*]first healing ability heals for 10% health of one person, which is useless
[*]after re-rolling, I keep all party members, but health does not get restored
[*]after re-rolling, duplicate party members respawn at their original locations, even though I have them already
[*]and more...
[/list]

[h1]+[/h1]
[list]
[*]I can move diagonally
[/list]

Absolute waste of time, even if it were free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146450963', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1507690815}
review:
Game #2 of the Month of Hard Love.

Get ready to experience a zombie apocalypse in the RPG genre with Invasion: Brain Craving.

[u]The Good >> Rough Atmosphere:[/u]

Given the gameâ€™s setup of a zombie apocalypse, the music selection used in this game is well executed. The tracks are decent and does help provide the atmospheric setting if the interface doesnâ€™t do it for you. The sound effects are also well executed.

Yeah... sorry, but thatâ€™s all I got for The Good.


[u]The Bad >> Rough Setup:[/u]

Now, Iâ€™m not familiar with how RPG maker works when it comes to setting up the gameâ€™s options, i.e. screen size or control setup, but if there was a setup to give the player the choice to make those adjustment, it would help to have something here, because thereâ€™s no options menu to be found in the game.

Now, not having the option to change the screen size doesnâ€™t bother me a great deal, but not knowing the button layout for the game is a problem. This means the player has to spend a few minutes figuring out what every button does before actually getting started.

I guess one consolation to this is that you could find something that can break the game in two.


[u]The Ugly >> Rough Start:[/u]

The beginning of the game is not made for beginners, as it throws you in the middle of the apocalypse. Now, given the gameâ€™s scenario, someone might ask â€œHow is that a bad thing?â€ Well, itâ€™s one bad thing when the game provides little instructions when you start a new game and another when the zombies are stronger than you.

Another thing to note is that you need to find supplies to keep your hunger from reaching zero or else youâ€™ll starve to death. Finding supplies in this game is almost like finding a needle in a haystack, because you can find some chests in the open, which could contain food or something else, but when you open every chest possible, it becomes a game of luck to find something to help you from whatever problem youâ€™re dealing with.



The concept of making an RPG game involving a zombie apocalypse isnâ€™t something thatâ€™s been done frequently, if not before, as opposed to the FPS genre. Unfortunately, the problem here is that it starts bad and doesnâ€™t really improve as the game progresses. In general, it didnâ€™t execute very well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1496185052}
review:
RPG Maker strikes again!   This is another low effort retro-pixel JRPG ripoff spamming the Steam catalog, made with the RPG Maker video game construction kit... in their own words, "Our easy to use tools are simple enough for a child."

This isn't even a good RPG Maker game.  This is an unfinished, buggy mess with some game breaking bugs.

Gamers who want a good retro gaming experience would be better off playing the original Final Fantasy games or one of the better RPG Maker games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128383171', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1488411723}
review:
Zombiekiller / Surviver RPG
Doesn't really have a story - You only aim is to survive, grind and save other people to survive together as long as possible.
Has a few bugs like getting stuck on one of the trees when changing screens on a certain spot or invisible enemies when fighting the werecar but well.. good to kill time and I liked the music.
Would have been a great game if they included a story (and fixed said bugs) but still had fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013296662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1515437403}
review:
Dunno what I am supposed to do with this game. I pick a player name, explore a tiny room, pick up some food, and a weapon.  
The only other thing I can do is the first thing which happened in the game; I walked through a wall in to the surrounding blankness.

Same thing has happened for three atempts at playing.  Where is the game???

Edit:  After more experimenting, it seems you must exit through the window-looking light source at the bottom.  However, you must exit straight toward the door.  You can't walk left or right and then exit the door.  That's impossible.  You must walk directly north to south to exit.
It's literally easier to find a bug in the wall!

The game isn't bad after that, but combat is nothing special.  The best part is in avoiding the zombie hordes and picking them off in small groups.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970840876', 'num_games_owned': 1298, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1509025637}
review:
I only recommend this game to people that know what they want to get.

THIS IS BASICLY A RPG MAKER ASSET FLIP.


- No Story
- Grind, Grind more
- Ehm Soundtrack is so-so. Music kinda rocks but gets repetetive.
- Everything is very basic.
- Graphics are RPG Maker-ish. You know, pixels. No additional art was added.
- Car Zombie might be the only non asset flip
- i seriously run out of things to say about this
- oh yeah there is almost no gameplay aside from hitting enter in fights
- more effort hass gone in making the achievements of the game, then in the making of the game. At least it seems like it.
- if you like the RPG maker fighting, and give a crap about sound, graphics, gameplay, story or basically anything that makes a game worth playing then this is for you.
- or you are an achievement hunter. then this game will punish you.
- or you are a masochist, that wants to punish himself. Then by all means this game is a cheap painful way to do this.

Final veredict:

-666/101

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1502563197}
review:
Tags: Topdown - RPGMaker & Party RPG
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Its always nice to have a change from fantasy in RPGMaker games but this feels early access and unfinished

Nice maps but very few things are interactable, some inside building maps are broken and require the use of a betafunction to even navigate them, no party composition, no special skills, no ability to escape fights, attrition on ressources is high, zombies do not drop anything really useful, hunger meter is an ill conceived feature, Very easy to get boxed in and lose. No clear objective, you start the game immune to being a zombie and well thats it. Did not find any scripts that offered a narrative.

Where do developers of games like this go to die? do they just go "oops" and hope for a few pennies to show up in their paypal account from whereever they manage to sell a key , like in some 32 games for a dollar bundle..lol are they embarassed? DO they tell/show their friends, hey look , i made a game and got in on steam. Or would you rather keep disasters quiet?.These are the kinds of things I ponder as I attempt to play such a thing from some 1$ bundle and see it has bottom of the barrel reviews. do they ever think, hey, i wonder if I took some time from my burger king job to brush up on my programming, coding, or skills, i wonder if could rise it from the ashes like a pheonix and yell...see!...I wasn't fishing for pennies in the steam scam graveyard, i really was making a game and I stand victorius and forgiven...

author: {'steamid': '76561198154333564', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1496691988}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019812735', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1493928760}
review:
[b][h1]=The Abridged=[/h1][/b]
Invasion - Brain Craving is a RPG maker-made Zombie game, made with pre-made assets, and a couple of pop-culture references thrown in as per standard with the Zombie genre... Aaand that's about it. There's not much to the game, and it's pretty much a very short play unless you're trying to 100% it, of which grinding is to be expected. And given that there's no proper end or story to it, it's going to lose your attention pretty quickly.  


[b][h1]=The In-Depth Review=[/h1][/b]

[h1]=The Story: 0/5=[/h1] 
As stated above: What story? It's a generic 'The world has been infected with a zombie virus, your character is one of those immune to it, have fun' story... Even in the first minute of the game it acknowledges this.

[h1]=The User Interface: 1/5=[/h1]
There's honestly not much of a UI. It's your standard RPG maker windows, of which fortunately fit in coloration tone with the game's dark atmosphere. You got your menu screen, your conversation boxes, and then your run-of-the-mill combat UI. About the only thing this one does different is a hunger meter in the upper corner that I'll go in to more depth in the next section.

[h1]=The Gameplay: 2/5=[/h1]
Again, not much originality going on here. It's your typical RPG-maker combat system, with poor balancing. The only two kinds of weapons your characters can have or use are knives, and two different kind of guns, thats all there is. With knives being vastly inferior to the two guns you can get, and only really being semi-decent on a character proficient with knives. 

There's a hunger system, which is a pretty interesting add in to the game. Of which makes it so you need to find food to refill your hunger in order to not die from starvation, so pretty normal I guess. Except I've only really seen it go down after fights. So general idea is to avoid zombies if you get hungry... Otherwise they might get hungry... All over you. 

There's also bugs in the game, such as the health packs not restoring AP, the werecar (I kid you not) having 3-4 extra invisible enemies that die at the start of the battle, and are -supposed- to just exist in order to make the car seem closer to you... Only they resurrect themselves within their turn, and are actually harder to defeat than the bloody miniboss itself. Oh, and after a certain period in the game, zombies stopped chasing me alltogether. Dunno if that's the same for anyone else though.

I will give some props for the 're-roll' system, which is basically like a new game+ with a new random layout each time. But that basically only serves to semi-extend the game and make it so you can find the rest of the companions in the game.

Also grenades suck, hands down. 

[h1]=The Graphics: 1/5=[/h1] 
With most-to-completely pre-made assets, it's hard to really rate this on it's own merit. As anything good about them would have to be credited to the original creator of them. Still, I have to give at least one point, in the case of some of the assets potentially being custom made by the developer. 

And the assets at least all look as though they belong in the same game, with the exception of the tombstones in the graveyard that can be randomly generated at times. Those are pretty much really really low resolution versions of a older RPG maker asset. 

[h1]=The Music: 1/5=[/h1] 
Again, I'm pretty sure this is another case of pre-made assets. The music... Well, it fits the game pretty well. And lends itself to the atmosphere, with the exception of the battle music. Which is a pretty generic rock-and-roll based combat theme. So it doesn't sound bad per-say? It just isn't something you'll find yourself listening to later on when you're not playing this game.


You'll just find yourself listening to it later on when you're playing someone -else's- game. 

[h1]=The Atmosphere: 2/5=[/h1] 
It does pretty well in the atmosphere department, with there being plenty of blood and gore as is expected of a zombie game. The tones of the assets are decently done to accentuate the atmosphere of a rainy and glum day, and the music plays well in amplifying it as well. They even have a night-time mode that kicks in, but I've not really noticed any increased difficulty or more zombie density at night like I had expected.

[b][h1]=TL;DR/Pros & Cons=[/h1][/b]

[b]Pros[/b]
- Moderately easy to 100%
- Easy to figure out and play
- You get PLENTY of companions!

[b]Neutral/YMMV[/b]
- Run-of-the-mill RPG Maker style gameplay
- It's a ZOMBIE GAME in RPG MAKER
- A handful of pop-culture references (though very few that fit the genre)
- The hunger system adds a requirement of needing to find and eat food, making you have to avoid zombies in the cases of high-hunger.

[b]Cons[/b]
- Not many items in the game
- Balancing isn't done very well
- It's got bugs in it that can make the game more difficult
- The developer has either dropped it or cares very little for it
- Did I mention that Grenades suck?

[b][h1]=The Conclusion: 2/10=[/h1][/b] 

[b]BUY IT ON SALE, IF EVEN BUYING IT AT ALL[/b]
Highly disappointing, as I had hoped for something with a bit more of a active, on-map battle system. That and it really becomes less immersive as you see graphics and hear music you've seen in heard in other RPG maker games. Due to most if not all the assets, again, are pre-made. Anyone, feel free to correct me if I'm wrong on this though. 

But the concept is a interesting, potentially good idea! Though the execution displayed was... Rather poor to say the least. Ah well, I'm sure with plenty of polishing and work, it could become something great, however the developer doesn't seem to be very interested in doing that as far as I've seen. (Feel free to correct me on that as well)

Oh well... The trailer is amusing at least? Though shows a older build of the game that honestly looks like it's better than the version we got.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011965365', 'num_games_owned': 2442, 'num_reviews': 2092, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1491351962}
review:
Making  A JRPG survival game with RPG MAKER is clearly hard to do.. Exspecially making the game actually worth playing and fun.This game just isnt fun at all. All you do is survive and find people to save.. Theres nothing really new in this RPG MAKER game.. All looks like the same o assets from the numerous of zombie games ive played.

Pros
Random worlds each time you play
Items, party members and exp carry over (re-roll)

Cons
During text boxes zombies still move
Cant Restore AP
zombies are no threat
Combat system 
Directions on where to go unclear

author: {'steamid': '76561198026447716', 'num_games_owned': 1534, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1478969782}
review:
Got this as part of a steam bundle. Would not recommend at any price.

Lets see:

- Active time battles? As in wait for your timer to fill then pray your attack hits the zombie before they all kill you in a multi hit combo (see next line).
- Any zombie nearby enters the battle when you touch one zombie. Yes, this is "realistic" I figure. However, given that the game gives you no incentive to play (I only played it to see what it ws about after getting the bundle, then quickly lost interest after 1 minute) and the fact that a group of 3-4 zombies can end your game less than 5 minutes of starting it, its no good.
- No incentive whatsoever to play. This is worst thing a game developer (or aspiring one) can do. Making it challenging and making it so that the player just does something else are two different things.
- Bad map design. Whenever I read randomized, I ten to just read an eyebrow. I mean eventually things just tend to be variations of a set of rules rather than really randomized. In any case, this game would hve benefited of some actual scripting and writing and true map design rather than the developper being lazy and going for arbitrary rules just because  it seemed map design was too much of a hassle (that is the impression I got).

This game feels like a school or university assignment that the student got bored halfway through, then decided to release it just to see how mch money he could get out of it. This highlights the need for some sort of QA on steam before indie games get released on steam.

Again, NOT recommended even if it were free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103504574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1477283811}
review: The idea behind the game is pretty good, and has a lot of potential, it just need a fine tuning on the fight system and hunger, the problem is that the world is very small, you can see everything in half an hour, maybe even less, it feels more like a demo than a finished game, this is why no matter how cheap it is, it's not worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561198078122880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1477215429}
review:
TLDR:Unfinished, don't waste your time or your money on this. 
No story, no objectives. You just wander aimlessly between the 9 screens (yes, just 9) avoiding zombies. The only thing "interesting" to do is gathering the 7 survivors and getting the achievements (wich wasn't even fun)....As for the "Randomly generated world with 729 combination possibilities! " and "Random event seeds ensure no two play-throughs are the same!", well....the only "events" I've seen is the othes survivors spawning on a map or not (and even when you've recruited them, they keep appearing..) and the "randomly generated world" is nothing more than a rearranged map with sometimes an open door to a building (there's not many building accessible and almost nothing inside)...
The last point, scavenging for supplies, the one I was really looking forward to.....is almost a sham !
All you can do is look into garbage and maybe find a food item (you lose stamina after each fight and once at 0, you die), a medkit or a grenade but there's not much to loot...

Not much fun to be had honestly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987731882', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1474580961}
review:
Idea may sound good.

But, Game is 
Unpolished and Unplayable, 
poor item/loot mechanics,
rooms that are unpassable in buildings,
alot of others .....
Survival game that have no chance of survival unless utilizing the cheat item provided.

Does not understand why would a survival game be only 3x3 square grid,
gives you a 'reroll of map' and repeat asking input of name.

Whats the point of watching a long snake wriggling around the map, referring to the line of team members.

Werecar, unique but silly.


Other than to clear the achievements and trading cards,
at present, this game is pointless.

ApÃ³s isso, vocÃª sai por ai andando numa cidade formada de 9 Ã¡reas com mapas de creio eu 30x30 tiles, cada Ã¡rea tem 2 variaÃ§Ãµes possÃ­veis de mapa que aparecem na sua run (pura sorte). Em cada tile tem uma cacetada de zumbis andando atrÃ¡s de vocÃª e vc trombar neles no comeÃ§o do jogo Ã© quase morte certa.
VocÃª comeÃ§a com um item concedido pelo capiroto que te deixa em modo fantasma e com isso vocÃª pode andar de boas por ai pegando recursos que, digasse de passagem, sÃ£o extremamente escassos.
O jogo deve ter um 12 itens diferentes no total (armas + armaduras + consumÃ­veis + key...), ou seja, quase nada.

O seu early game Ã© sair por ai andando no modo fantasma juntando recursos e recrutando sobreviventes (7 possÃ­veis), os quais tambÃ©m aparecem POR PURA SORTE (sendo que na minha primeira run nÃ£o apareceu NENHUM, tive que dar new game e procurar).
Depois que vocÃª formou uma gangue que pode chegar a atÃ© 8 personagens (todos), vc sai por ai matando uns zumbis e usando suas habilidades (que gastam AP), tendo certeza que o kit mÃ©dico restaura o AP... MAS NÃƒO RESTAURA.
Ai depois que vocÃª ficou fortinho ou que acabou sua comida, vocÃª vai dar re-roll no mundo pra pegar mais itens e tendo certeza que seu HP e AP vÃ£o recuperar pro re-inÃ­cio... MAS NÃƒO, SEU AP NUNCA SE RECUPERARÃ E SEU HP FICARÃ O MEMSO ATÃ‰ VOCÃŠ USAR KITS MÃ‰DICOS.
QUANDO UM PERSONAGEM RECRUTADO MORRE ELE DESAPARECE PERMNENTEMENTE DA PARTY E NÃƒO Ã‰ RECUPERADO NEM DANDO RE-ROLL NO JOGO E ENCONTRANDO ELE NOVAMENTE PARA RECRUTAR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1470587558}
review:
"Invasion: Brain Craving" ist ein Zombie-Survival Game im Stile eines RPG-Maker Titels.

Die Story ist Standard: InfektionsgedÃ¶ns, alle werden Zombies, nur wir sind immun...blablabla... schon so oft gehÃ¶rt.

Unsere Hauptaufgabe: andere Ãœberlebende finden, die wir dann in unsere Party integrieren. WÃ¤hrenddessen sollten wir nach Dosen suchen um unseren Hunger zu stillen oder nach Health Packs um uns zu heilen. Laufen wir Zombies in die Arme, laufen klassische rundenbasierte KÃ¤mpfe ab, in denen wir unseren Protagonisten rudimentÃ¤re Befehle geben.

Die Map ist mit wenigen Screens erstaunlich winzig. Um das zu kompensieren, scheinen die Entwickler auf die Idee gekommen zu sein, einen Roll-up zu machen. Das heiÃŸt: wenn wir einen bestimmten Punkt auf der Karte erreichen, kÃ¶nnen wir speichern und wieder am Anfang starten, behalten allerdings unsere Kompagnons. So ganz erschlieÃŸt sich aber nicht, weshalb ein Reroll Ã¼berhaupt existiert, denn speichern kÃ¶nnen wir sonst auch jederzeit und die Statuswerte unserer Truppe werden auch nicht zurÃ¼ckgesetzt. Das einzige: die Karte Ã¤ndert sich leicht, da diese immer wieder random aus VersatzstÃ¼cken zusammengesetzt wird. 

Das Spiel wirkt hinten und vorne unfertig, wie eine Demo. Wesentliche Elemente sind funktionslos. Zwar kÃ¶nnten wir unsere Kleidung Ã¤ndern, finden aber keine. Scrap Metal kriegen wir nach jedem gewonnenen Kampf, kÃ¶nnen aber nichts mit dem Reichtum anfangen. Dazu noch ist das Balancing grottig. Die Gegner leveln einfach mit, Abwechslung fehlt. Auch taktisch bleibt Alles an der OberflÃ¤che. Der Bossgegner, ein Zombieauto, ist dafÃ¼r so overpowert, daÃŸ er uns im frÃ¼hen Spiel killt, bevor wir Ã¼berhaupt irgendetwas machen kÃ¶nnen.

Grafisch ist das Ganze auf RPG-Maker Asset Niveau, die Musik ist ebenso qualitÃ¤tsbefreit und technisch ist es immer wieder grottig. Die Steuerung ist ungenau, gern bleibt man an Ecken hÃ¤ngen, dafÃ¼r glitcht man auch mal durch WÃ¤nde durch.    

SpaÃŸ macht die dauernde Wiederholung desselben zu keinem Zeitpunkt. Doch, falsch, zu einem schon: zu dem an dem man das Spiel beendet.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
2/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
1/10 Story
2/10 Grafik
1/10 Sound
1/10 Spielmechanik
1/10 Balancing
1/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Grottig grauenvolles GaminggedÃ¶ns.

[h1][b]1/10 Gesamtwertung

review: Very sluggish, hard to get into. Object and map boundaries are not clearly defined. Combat system is extremely imbalanced. There is no motivation given to continue playing. No story, no goals, you just go screen to screen trying to avoid combat. Not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233944892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1528343431}
review:
I really wanted to recommend this game, but I can't.

The combination of Zombie-Survival and JRPG is pretty cool, but the game is poorly made. I bought it a long time ago on Early Access stage, and yeah, what should I say?
I really got into the game. Even though it didn't have much of a story, I liked the hints they gave on it. Same with the characters. They didn't have much to say, but I found myself quite addicted to them. So I was looking forward to the future development of the game, I wanted to know more about the story and it's background. And I was confident, the game would provide me of it with further development.

But I was so wrong. The last update was in April. Nothing changes since then... but the fact, it left Early Access. I wonder why? They didn't do anything with the game. There is still no story, no goal... and even worse, nothing has been done about the known bugs. You can't buy anything, even if you collect scraps, the games currency. You can't even fill up your AP, which means once you used up the initial AP, you're screwed.

So even though it makes me sad, I can't recommend this game to anyone. It's not really a game.. It's something that could have become an amazing game... but was dropped and left in an unplayable state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026535249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1467712977}
review:
Disgustingly Bad.

It is super cheap, but not only this game is not worth your money, it's also not worth a single second of your time. 

There is, what, 9 map screens? and they have increasingly more enemies. You find a couple health pack in the trash, and a shotgun in a car/building. Aaaand that's it. Literally. There is absolutely nothing in this game. You kill some, level up, heal, kill, lvl up, heal. End game? flip a switch to reset the map with your items............

I have no idea what this game is trying to be, because at this point, it is nothing in particular but trash.. Do not waste your precious time on this abomination of a game that is nothing more than a 1st year college project..

author: {'steamid': '76561198060277415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1468228566}
review:
Invasion: Brain Craving is a game that I can't recommend because:
- at the moment it doesn't deserve to be paid to be played
- it is boring
- it has issues
- the design is pretty bad
- the tutorial takes only 10 seconds and it learns you nothing more than you already know
- the storyline doesn't exist
- it looks more like an unfinished game 
- the only good reason to install this game is for the trading cards

author: {'steamid': '76561198066271681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1468139176}
review:
This game needs so much work. In the first 20 minutes or so I had no complaints. But the only reason I played for as long as I did was to try and get the achievements. However, this game isn't worth going the extra mile for a couple reasons:

-No apparent way to restore AP
-Scrap serves no purpose (Why have it?)
-Dead characters can be found again through Re-Roll, but join your party dead
-Enemies still move around when text boxes are up
-Only way to get to certain places/characters is by using ghost skull
-Kill count doesnt carry over on re-roll
This woundn't matter so much if character health/ap regenerated on re-roll or dead characters could be picked up again after re-roll at full health, but it makes trying to get achievements just an annoying chore instead of a fun milestone.

I do like a couple things

+Items, party members and exp carry over on re-roll
+Use of hunger as survival mechanism makes it more engaging
+Humor. Because I'm trying really hard to make some good points.
+Oh, and you get Trading cards. Basically the reason I played it at all.

Final appraisal: Don't buy as is. Get on sale for cards, if that's your thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012221863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1466661134}
review:
[h1]Craving a better game[/h1]

Okay, Invasion: Brain Craving is a cheap game. It is an RPGMaker game. It does not pretend to be the new and improved Resident Evil. Even taking the above into account, I can't recommend this game at all.

On the plus side, it does have some graphical customisation and an extremely corny intro. Oh, and some ideas have been tried.

On the minus side? Where to even begin? You'll need to reboot/keybash to get it to play in fullscreen and forget about using a controller as the controls are... iffy at best. All challenge vanishes from battles as you get guns and recruit party members. At least until you hit the bugged were-car miniboss battle. Once the 'boss' does run-over, you are dead, but you can't hit him properly due to a large number of Blank Slate invisible enemies and zombies also in the battle.
Area transition is atrocious, you end up in trees more often than not, movement is constricted and some buildings let you walk all over them. The environments do not feel like a real urban environment, more like a box fort. The music, such as there is, borrows heavily from other games. In addition to these points, you are also hampered by a hunger bar. For the entire party one hunger bar. IT DOES NOT ADD TO THE FUN, being a boring chore.

In short, avoid this game like a zombie-apocalypse. Even at 80+% discounts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038364422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1522865996}
review: When I first bought the game it was not very great. But now that the developer has spent time updating the game (and I would really enjoy it if development continued), I actually like the game because of many reason (my opinions). I am huge in to zombie games such as CS:NZ, L4D2, Zombie Panic Source!, etc. and when I played this game I found that it promots cooperation. The key feature in a fun zombie game is when you have fun playing it, this game currently does not have a lot of places to go but I believe in time Invasion: Brain Craving will be a really awesome game. Another reason it is good is that it is balenced in gameplay, the zombies are not to easy and not to hard and there is the right amount of zombies in each area. Now let me point out a few things that I do not like then go over them at the end :) First: Only two enterable buildings (only one has loot). Two: Not really any items added in besides cans of beans and health packs. Three: Can not see zombies when moving behind buildings. Four: Not a lot of areas to go to and there not progressive in difficulty (besides the area with the werecar). And Fifth: I really would like to see if the developer does want to continue updating this game, if so I will play the game a whole lot and tell my friends about. Conclution - I suck at writting reviews but I enjoy this game as a person who loves zombie games and I will continue to play it ever update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262864341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1462673743}
review:
Better than I expected, at first.  F5/F6 toggling & restarted until I got the full screen working properly.  I used an xbox360 controller, which worked fine (buttons X to select, B to backout).  Make sure you find and equip yourself with a weapon quickly.  There isn't a lot of text, so it didn't strain my eyes.  It was fun, I died and restarted a few times, and I got the hang of it.  But that's when the fun halted.  I'm not sure I understand what I am supposed to be doing in this game.  I avoid zombies, fight a few, find a rare healthkit or weapon or two, run out of medkits and die.  There doesn't seem to be anywhere really to go or do beyond repeat this avoid, fight-a-few, and eventually die.  I got 30 minutes of fun, then confused.

This is early access.  First 30 minutes was 4/5 stars, then 1/5 stars after if that was all there was.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003785049', 'num_games_owned': 4805, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1466571157}
review:
Invasion Brain Craving, La historia se basa en un chico llamado Erick (el cual podemos ponerle el nombre que queramos) que ha sobrevivido a una epidemia zombi y el cual en teoria ha sido inmune a la cepa. A partir de hay pues te inventas la historia que te de la real gana, por que el juego carece de sentido en adelante.

Tubo buenas criticas en green-light pero a acabado siendo una estafa y un infierno con una espera ya casi de 5 meses camino ya de medio aÃ±o. El no recibir actualizaciones o noticias de los creadores da que pensar de que el juego se va a quedar hay como esta actualmente, siendo un sistema de nuevas partidas con un pequeÃ±o gestor de mapas rpg maker aleatorios en cada nueva partida, pero con hechar 2 o 3 te aburriras.

Lo bueno:
-Dificultad muy dificil algo que le da realismo, hasta que encuentras a supervivientes rondando por hay
-Sistema de combate tambiÃ©n realista el cual pueden infectarte y dejarte la vida a 1 HP
-DiseÃ±os muy atractivos para un juego
-Tiene trofeos
-Tiene cromos
-Cada partida es diferente (dentro de lo que cabe hasta que llegas a una 4 o 5 partida y es todo lo mismo) al poco desarollo que le han dado.

Lo malo:
-No esta en espaÃ±ol (para no variar)
-Tiene cantidad de bug y cosas absurdas 
-La musica de inicio de la casa se bugea y no vuelve a salir ninguna banda sonora a no ser que vuelvas a la casa inicial
-En el inventario te encuentras un objeto "cheat" para testear el juego que sera inacabable y quitandole toda la poca gracia que ya tenia el juego y sacando logros a costa de esto.
-No actualizan desde dos dias despues de la fecha de lanzamiento
-Incluso costando lo que cuesta, solo pagaria 0,08 â‚¬ por el.
-Carece de historia, solo sobrevives a partir de hay reclutas a algun compaÃ±ero que veas y yasta destruir al zombi coche...
-Te obligan a fallecer para vivir  en una nueva partida una nueva caca de mapa aleatorio igual de cutre y sin sentido.

Nota final: 2.1

PD: esperaba que trabajaran el juego, pero llevo 5 meses esperando actualizaciones y nada de nada, supongo que este juego a muerto al igual que los zombis que aparecen en Ã©l.

review:
El juego es interesante por el estilo RPG de supervivencia y tiene mucho potencial.

Particularmente he juntado los 8 personajes enseguida y pude conseguir el 100% de los logros.  Al haber tan pocas armas y escenarios el juego se vuelve repetitivo.. Enter, enter, enter, enter, curarse, enter, enter, enter, comer para no morir, enter, enter, etc.

Algo que le falta es la traducciÃ³n a otros idiomas para poder disfrutar la historia si es que va a tener una.

Por es momento es muy corto pero seguramente va a mejorar y por eso la recomendaciÃ³n.

review:
If I could call this a casual-RPG, i would. You can save anytime. You level up like an old fashioned RPG. Battle like an old RPG. But it's not as long. You play to find all the survivor characters. I like the concept. It's still in early access and I'm waiting on the dev to fix the werecar battle. 

In it's current state, after the last update: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198277011659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1457012328}
review: This can be a fantastic game, with endless amout of gametime and content, it's not at the moment, the fun only lasts awhile now, but it's in early access so it shouldn't really be done. At the moment, it's mostly walking around killing zombies in an old school rpg kind of way, while exploring a random city. You of course get xp for kills but also "scrap" which you can't use for the moment, there's no real goal either. But when they fix that, this can be something really special. If you are looking for a game, don't buy this yet, wait until it's done. If you like what you see about the game, buy it now to support the developers to finish this, we all want to see the end product!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078589848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1455354328}
review:
It's bad if you get stuck in a tree in the first 5 minutes twice in a row in two seperate play throughs. If there will be bad bugs that early on, it's not worth playing. There are many other better games out there that you will enjoy. I've played a lot of early access games and this one had the fastest bugs/ game breaking issues yet.

It's understandable if a game has bugs, but that early and frequent means something is not being done correctly by the developers.

Avoid this game until they fix or more so wait until they release the full game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012034127', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1462865340}
review:
Currently, the game is very rough. It's extremely simple to get wiped out early on if you get a bad string of luck where you can't find any companions. You can, however, have a full group of six running around. You'll need them to tackle the heavy amount of wandering hordes hunting you down (to say nothing of a 'were-car'). On your own, your life expectancy might be a few minutes at best. Characters are individually quite weak- you must search the city to find people and perhaps a little equipment, although the game is very thin on the latter right now.

There's no goal at this time, other than just to survive as long as you can. If you can manage long enough, you can reroll the maps to a new area with your levels and companions. Additionally, the zombies also level (and rather quickly, too). 

Again, this might not sound like much, but there's an interesting idea and an experience here. I want to see Invasion turn into more of an in depth zombie survival rpg experience, with a goal and nuances. Maybe that won't happen. I suppose we'll see. So you might want to hold off until there's more of a game under the hood, but with the extremely low price, you probably won't be hurting just to try for the challenge and experience of the concept.

At this time, the game is rather buggy and crude. There seems to be a little too much emphasis on references and quips, which didn't really work for me, as well. Characters could stand to have more abilities and personality. And to really flesh out the zombie survival experience, the game needs far more equipment. 

This used to be a Recommended review, as I cited there was potential here. But the developer doesn't seem to be doing much of anything with this title. As of this writing, he hasn't updated any meaningful content and the developer has gone silent on the forums. By itself, the game is overly limited even for an Early Access. Not sure why the title is seemingly being ignored into a state of barely functioning limbo, but I can't in good conscience recommend it, even for a dollar's value. It's one of those greenlit titles that has a kernal of a good idea in it, but it apparently isn't being helmed by anyone willing to make it work.

review:
So much wrong with this game.

-Died multiple times from being attacked by a horde while trying to check a "container." 

-Description says "Plethora of recruitable characters!" Out of the 4 times I played I found 1. 

-The biggest annoyance of this game is constantly getting stuck on grass. I don't know what they were thinking making a grass sprite solid. 

-The inability to play in window mode is frustrating. 

Granted this is in Early Access but, a lot of this should be things they would/should have noticed by playing though the game once. 

I'll check back in a few months to see if anything has changed, so far I would say stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005271335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1451828740}
review:
So I've spent some time playing this game, and -- well, what can I say, JRPGs and survival don't mix well.

This game is basically a product of RPG Maker or a similar software, with some tweaks towards making it a "survival" game (gosh, we don't have enought survival games as is, now do we?). And while the concept may have it's potential, this game certainly has none. With the current gameplay, all it basically does is mixing the screens randomly, hoping for something good to magically happen in the process (spoiler alert: it doesn't).

The battle system is dull and boring -- if you've ever played a JRPG, you know how it works. The battles are turn-based, turns are determined by ATB gauge. You can perform one action per turn: attack, defend, use an item, use a technique (aka "special" attack), which consumses your "mana" (at the moment, I couldn't find a way to replenish it, by the way).

The storyline is entirely missing. You have your 10-seconds tutorial, telling you that you're immune to... a pathogen? Well, there's that. And this is all you need to know, evidently.

Also, the game is *really* buggy -- enemies are glitching (the "werecar" monster is just terrible at passing stuff), decorations are glitching, your character is glitching and sometimes stucking irreversibly in obstacles... I mean, sure, this is an Early Access product, but come on, can you do *some* beta-testing before releasing the game?

All in all, this is a very, very wonky game with foggy outlook. I'd rate it [b]3.5 out of 10.0[/b], and I wouldn't recommend anyone to buy it, as of now.

(If the game develops any further, I might change this review later on)

- - - - - - - - 

Yup, RPG Maker confirmed: game uses "Horror City" DLC for RPG Maker VX, so no original art is coming your way here either. I'm changing my rating from 3.5 to 1.0 out of 10.0.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165746257', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1458162606}
review:
I put this as a yes because for intensive purposes the game is fairly good. I mean we aren't talkin Episode 7 levels of good here were talking a good mix of elements with decent rpg combat. Where it fall short is in its buggyness and lack of patches or really a community following. I don't know what the dev does, or how he does it but the game feels hard but at the point where the player is getting frustrated at every turn around the never ending streets of this game. 

-You can get stuck in objects that make no sense being stuck behind (Small Plants or Bushes) 

-You start off entirely useless, like we're talking red shirt levels of useless. I havent survived to get past level 2 yet. 

-Other Companions start off higher level then you, which causes enemies to scale. 

-No way to escape battles you accidentally encounter (If I have 50 hp, there is no way I'm surviving an encounter even with a level one zombie, it ain't happening)

Now while these are a few negatives, the game is fun and a challenge but its almost too challenging. The fact that all my gear comes from zombie drops or garbage cans is kinda silly, theres not even a merchant that I have found that will sell me food. Kind of farfetched of an idea for a merchant, but you can easily bullshit that into a game and have at least one safe area for your players to rearm, re-equip, and re-supply. There is also a lack of a way to fully heal your character outside of medkits which is a design flaw in my opinion. 

If the game was ment to be sometimes frustratingly hard, or even just challenging, I think it needs a few.. stepping stones, for players to hop onto inbetween fighting numerous undead that will forever lumber their way towards the nearest sack of flesh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025997708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1451515600}
review:
[u][b][h1]First Hour Impressions[/h1][/b][/u]
[i]So I played for an hour and wrote very pessimistic notes about my experiences. I'm now sharing these notes with you to help you patch up and see how a new player experiences your game. Spoilers may be present for those thinking about getting this game, but in this stage I don't think spoilers are possible, nevertheless this is mostly for the developer. Warning: this will be lengthy, but hopefully helpful.[/i]

[h1]Gameplay Notes[/h1]
[list]
[*]Combat gets dull, ZZ, wait a sec, ZZ, wait a sec, etc. (but then again it's early-game)
[*]When do I get techniques? Why don't I start with a simple one?? Even the zombies get "Endure6" or whatever it says (what does that say? and what does it do? I'm very curious)
[*]Real-time should stop when you're trying to read or just picked something up: I picked up a health pack and then got attacked by a swarm because I couldn't grab and run
[*]Killed a huge swarm in front of a store because I figured I could go into it, but it's not even interactive
[*]Took me about 30 minutes total of aimlessly wondering and fighting to find first survivor
[*]Why doesn't food for hunger also replenish health? It's food...
[*]First survivor I find is at least 4x stronger than me, not a problem just strange
[*]Actually really cool that you can die and then just continue as a survivor
[*]Gets hard too fast, only seen one survivor, no store no other NPCs, nothing, and it's already like my last stand
[*]Movement's too slow and stiff for a real-time game where you have to avoid zombies
[*]Impassable objects hidden behind buildings
[*]No way to tell which survivor is attacking, or if there is it's super subtle
[*]Too many zombies right off the bat, the game needs a difficulty progression, and it starts with getting swarmed by 20 zombies a screen, it's just too much
[*]Straight up don't understand the hunger bar, does it get smaller the hungrier I am? If so, how do I know just HOW small it is compared to how big it could be?
[*]The only part that feels like an actual game is the very beginning, with the dialogue, secret health pack, and scripted zombie attack. Once I leave the building I feel like I'm stuck in limbo between what I just did and the next story point/NPC/etc., only problem is the next action never comes. I found a newspaper that talked about the emergence of the zombies, which was neat, but only unique discovery I've found thus far aside from the survivors
[*]Is the Tiger Defence Academy bit designed purposefully so I get attacked while reading it??
[*]Survivor's just have like a one-liner, then start following you around. Why not some back-and-forths or something?
[*]I would've said the Shotgun's technique that shoots every enemy is OP considering it has barely any damage reduction as opposed to just shooting one enemy, but then again the swarm one shot me anyway because each zombie hit's around 100, there were at least 10 of them, and I had 500 health max, but like 250 at the time
[*]In the entire time I've played this I've only found one other building to go into
[/list]

[h1]Aesthetic Notes[/h1]
[list]
[*]Nicely decorated but for gameplay's sake perhaps too decorated? Or be able to pass through more things
[*]Takes a second to distinguish character from zombies, and in a game where screen is changing alot and it spawns you not always right on the edge of the new screen, I can loose the character briefly which is not good in a zombie game
[*]There's a zombie type that looks almost exactly like the survivor Peach but with her arms out: it's confusing
[*]Needless to say that stock effects/graphics/sounds were used, which is very unappealing in the long-run: there's SO many RPGmaker games out there today, it's clear that the ones that are fully customized and no longer look or sound like RPGmaker are the ones that are successful
[/list]

[h1]Technical Notes[/h1]
[list]
[*]Can't minimize game without it breaking
[*]Starting the game flashes the screen fullscreen back to windowed repeatedly for a minute
[*]My hunger went down even though we couldn't open the Tin 'O Beans (but then jumped way back up a minute later??)
[*]Enemies respawn way too quickly, I leave screen and come back and they're back, what if I left screen on accident? There goes all my progress
[*]Near the park there's some car that seems like it's franticly trying to run me over but can never succeed even if it's directly on top of me; it follows me to neighboring screens
[*]Apparently if you hit Z you can fight this (zombie?) car. It looks super glitchy and this is probably a bug what I'm seeing; I targeted it and I shot the pond behind it, and it's name was all messed up but I can't check what it was since it one-shot me (like I said, difficulty is insane for this early in a game)
[*]Why can't you walk over bushes?
[*][b]DO NOT HIT F12 ANYONE. For some reason it immediately quits without saving...[/b]
[*]The combat system is strange, I like it because it's different but much more thought should be put into it to balance it out and make it a bit more concrete, I'm mostly talking about the fact that you don't necessarily take turns, but you just wait for your ATB to fill up, then you make an action
[*]It was still raining inside a building
[*]Whenever I try to "Shutdown" the game from the menu, the correct way, it goes unresponsive, a window comes up saying so and I have to tell it to give up trying to recover...
[/list]

[i]Overall, I like this game, it has tons of flaws and I found a bunch of tiny knit-picky problems with it but that's what Early Access is for. I hope to see this game improve consistently and look forward to the official release! Hope I helped, have a great day.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198062663486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1449764387}
review:
[H1]Check it out RPG/Zombie fans![/H1]
Invasion: Brain Craving is an addictive Zombie RPG.
Fear meets nostalgia! 
Invasion has all the great RPG elements, a great active time battle system, recruitable characters, collectable items and a large world. What's even better is that the world is randomly generated, so you get a fresh experience each time you play.

To summarise:
All the classic RPG elements in a apocalyptic, zombie ridden world. With a great pixel art style and a subtle catchy soundtrack. 
Awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198203340085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1449339434}
review:
[h1]This is not a bad game, but in it's current state, don't buy it.[/h1]

First of all, I know what you are thinking, ''It's early access you can't expect it to be perfect!'' and I hear you, but to let you people know, this is more of a debug build than an early access. It could have been released as a free demo, because in it's current state, it's not something that should be commercial. 

[h1]Let's start from the very beginning[/h1]

At the start of the game, you are thrown straight into the game where you name your character. No title screen, no splash screen. Nothing. You just straight up get thrown in, however, after saving there IS a title screen.
One problem I had is, except when I did it the first time, I get thrown into a map where I am stuck on a bunch of barrels and can't move everytime I start a new game. Holding shift also skips text which I appreciate but also don't. It's really annoying trying to read a tutorial but then accidentally pressing shift and skipping it all. Also the food you get never runs out. If you get hungry you can just go to your menu and keep choosing the tin of beans, it will not disappear at all.

I'm outside!

One problem I really had with the exteriors is it's so hard to tell where you are going. You can't tell where the borders are and you just get teleported to a new area out of nowhere. About gathering party members, I didn't like this system much either. They are just randomly lying around and they join you immediately if you just tell them to. I hope that in the final version maybe they will not be in areas filled with zombies(who stands around in the middle of all those zombies?)and maybe you will need to gain their trust first, by doing something like a sidequest. Also there are no loots around at all. I feel like more loots and some more weapons could be added. I like the idea of getting attacked by large hordes of zombies. They are easy to escape at times, however one thing that's really bothering me is how easy they are to kill. All you have to do is keep smashing space-bar, they are no challenge at all. The only way they can kill you is if you are alone. With party members you are like indestructible. Maps are ok, they are not bad but they are a little too much stacked together. Your battle system also gets buggy when you get more than 4 party members. I can see that the developer wanted to make it so that if one person dies the other will fight instead, but the enemies are so easy to defeat, so something like that won't be happening anytime soon. 

I feel that this game has a lot of potential but it needs polishing. I am sure the final version will be better, but the early access version just isn't worth buying. It's nothing that stands out too much. It won't keep you thrilled, it isn't full of fun, but it has potential. Just, wait for it to get some updates first.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EvqD3XbQIVg

I guess it's worth 50 cents?

author: {'steamid': '76561198039748007', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1450721940}
review:
It's a good start and I like where this zombie JRPG is going, can't wait for it to be expanded on. Although there are quite a few bugs that will hopefully be fixed/improved on in the full version.

-You can't reach the guy in the blue cap due to the bench and rocks blocking the way, so you can't recruit him.
-You're more than likely to accidentally travel screens due to the border not being visible.
-There's certain spots when travelling screens, where you would get stuck on an object upon changing screens.
-Loot and survivors aren't randomised, they'll always be found in the same spot.
-No options, needed to lower the volume and couldn't. Button mapping would be great as well.
-The only warning you get for your hunger is the hunger bar, I had forgotten about it at one point and my character exclaimed "I'm so hungry", then proceeded to die instantly. (A pre-warning could of helped)

author: {'steamid': '76561198012712253', 'num_games_owned': 2552, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1449166146}
review:
This game has a lot of bugs but I also see promise. I'm gonna give it a thumbs up because it's Early Access and I like the direction, despite walking out of the colision field once and spawning in the next screen stuck in a tree.

I guess it gives a new meaning to save often, but I really do like what I have seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168096862', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1454469115}
review:
[UPDATE]

The game showed a little more promise once I got a little further. I was running Windows Defender on Windows 10 and apparently Dell added something that was seen as a virus. As far as the audio goes, it blasted me with the music. I didn't see a way to change volume in game and when I minimized it, it showed a black screen where I could not change my volume. I guess that is a Windows problem. My gameplay came to an end after I acquired two friends. We ended up getting stuck in a traffic cone and that was it. Changed the rating because developer listened. thx
